verses.plain: And he said also unto his disciples, There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.

tokens.t: And he said also unto his disciples,
There was a certain rich man, which had a steward; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods.

verses.plain: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.

tokens.t: And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.

verses.plain: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.

tokens.t: Then the steward said within himself, What shall I do? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am ashamed.

verses.plain: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

tokens.t: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

verses.plain: So he called every one of his lord’s debtors unto him, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?

tokens.t: So he called every one of his lord’s debtors
, and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?

verses.plain: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.

tokens.t: And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.

verses.plain: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

tokens.t: Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

verses.plain: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.

tokens.t: And the lord commended the unjust steward, because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.

verses.plain: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

tokens.t: And I say unto you, Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

verses.plain: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

tokens.t: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

verses.plain: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?

tokens.t: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true

verses.plain: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who shall give you that which is your own?

tokens.t: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who shall give you that which is your own?

verses.plain: ¶ No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

tokens.t: ¶ No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

verses.plain: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

tokens.t: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

verses.plain: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

tokens.t: And he said unto them,
Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

verses.plain: The law and the prophets were until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.

tokens.t: The law and the prophets
until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.

verses.plain: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.

tokens.t: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.

verses.plain: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.

tokens.t: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from
husband committeth adultery.

verses.plain: ¶ There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:

tokens.t: ¶ There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:

verses.plain: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,

tokens.t: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,

verses.plain: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.

tokens.t: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man’s table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.

verses.plain: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;

tokens.t: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;

verses.plain: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

tokens.t: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

verses.plain: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.

tokens.t: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.

verses.plain: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.

tokens.t: But Abraham said, Son, remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted, and thou art tormented.

verses.plain: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that would come from thence.

tokens.t: And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that
from thence.

verses.plain: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house:

tokens.t: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father’s house:

verses.plain: For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

tokens.t: For I have five brethren; that he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torment.

verses.plain: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.

tokens.t: Abraham saith unto him, They have Moses and the prophets; let them hear them.

verses.plain: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.

tokens.t: And he said, Nay, father Abraham: but if one went unto them from the dead, they will repent.

verses.plain: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.

tokens.t: And he said unto him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.
